page.title: 10SMEATHARPE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Village Hall in Smeatharpe is the focal point as there is no pub etc. The hall can hold 1OO people and is run by a management committee. This comprises representatives from local organisations and parish councils. The hall is used by local clubs which include: a weekly Keep-Fit Club; a fortnightly Whist Drive; monthly Women's Institute meetings as well as Hall Committee meetings. Two pop groups rehearse there several times each week. The hall is also available for private parties. There are several annual village high- lights, these being: the Fete in August, Harvest Home in October (a short service, auction of produce, then a cider supper!); Guy Fawke Fire- work Display and Bonfire in November; the Christmas Whist Drive and Child- ren's Party in December.
